result.execSummary:
The defendant Terrelle D Oliver was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • 1st Deg. Sexual Assault-Use/Dang.Weapon, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(1)(b).
  • 1st Deg. Sexual Assault-Use/Dang.Weapon, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 13 years bifurcated sentence.
Concurrent with: Cts. 2&3

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and pay surcharge.  All other court costs are waived.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Defendant may not go into any establishments that sell alcohol except for restaurants and grocery stores.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Defendant must register with the Sex Offender Registry and comply with all rules and requirements of the Sex Offender Registry.  No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family).  No contact with anyone under the age of 18, other than defendant's chilren pursuant to Family Court order and other family with adult supervision, withour approval of agent.  Defendant may not possess any pornography.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent, including Sex Offender Treatment. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

records.addlTxt: It is ordered that the petition for review is denied, without costs; and it is further ordered that all other pending motions for relief are also denied.

809.24(2).
IT IS ORDERED that the petition for a writ of habeas corpus is denied without costs.
IT IS ORDERED that the petition for a writ of habeas corpus is dismissed. WIS. STAT. RULE 809.83(2).
IT IS ORDERED that the respondent shall file a response to the petition for a writ of habeas corpus within thirty days of the date of this order.

ORD that the motion is granted in part. Defendant-appellant shall have until November 5, 2018, to serve and file a supplemental petition in support of review. No further time extension will be granted.

ORD that the motion is granted.  Defendant-appellant shall have until September 4, 2018, to serve and file a statement in support of review. If the statement is not tiled by that time, this matter will be disposed of based solely on the petition filed by Attorney Zaleski.
